page.title: 04NORTH DURHAM VILLAGE (CONT)
page.content: The local Vicar leads a very busy life and the Church is used for Burials, Marriages and Christenings. Young and old alike attend the Church and the normal congregation is 120. More people have attended the Church in 1985 than in 1984. The Church is interesting and the Vicar often shows groups around. The Vicar often has to help with the problems that people face in their daily lives and he is often asked for advice. The local Church of West Pelton (C of E) is interesting because there is a Stained Glass Window donated by the villagers after they all escaped a Cholera epidemic which affected the whole of the rest of the area. There are also plaques to the mine-owning Fenwick family who gave the land for the Church to be built. There is also a large graveyard.
